snippet: Just 31 percent of third through eighth graders passed state reading tests and 38 percent passed math, both slight improvements from last year.
abstract: Over 200,000 students in third through eighth grades opted out of taking New York State's standardized tests in 2015, pointing to resistance to testing that is growing more forceful in many states; number is four times as high as in 2014 and represents 20 percent of eligible test-takers; situation increases pressure on officials over whether to punish schools with falling rates.
lead_paragraph: Just 31 percent of third through eighth graders passed state reading tests and 38 percent passed math, both slight improvements from last year.

headline.main: 20% of New York State Students Opted Out of Standardized Tests This Year
headline.print_headline: 20% of State Students Opted Out of Tests in Sign of a Rising Revolt
